meanings.definition: The breakdown of complex molecules in living organisms to produce energy.
meanings.sent1: During catabolism, cells break down food to get energy.
meanings.sent2: Catabolism is important for our bodies to get the energy they need.
meanings.sent3: The party in the cell was so wild that even catabolism couldn't keep up with the energy levels!
meanings.sent4: In the world of cells, catabolism is like a busy demolition crew breaking down big buildings to release energy.
meanings.sent5: Imagine catabolism as tiny workers inside cells, dismantling big structures to create power.

meanings.definition: The metabolic process in which cells break down molecules to obtain energy.
meanings.sent1: Cells use catabolism to break down food and get energy for all activities.
meanings.sent2: The body relies on catabolism to extract energy from the food we eat.
meanings.sent3: The race between anabolism and catabolism was so close, it ended in a tie!
meanings.sent4: Catabolism works like a skilled chef in a kitchen, breaking down ingredients to create the perfect energy dish.
meanings.sent5: In the cell's dance of life, catabolism is the energetic performer breaking down molecules with flair.
